intro: Kaulinia pteropus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser winged kaulinia, is a lesser-known species within the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, winged leaves that give it its common name, and it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological niche within its native habitat.
